erythraeus: <entryFree id="n16229" type="greek" key="e^rythraeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrythraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqrai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n16229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:2" default="NO">7, 3, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16229.1" n="II" level="1"> As an <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi>, v. Erythrae, II. B., and Erythras, II.</sense></entryFree>
erythraicon: <entryFree id="n16230" type="greek" key="e^rythra^i^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrythrăĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqrai+ko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n16230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant</hi> satyrion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 63, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erythranos: <entryFree id="n16231" type="greek" key="e^ry_^thra^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrȳ^thrănos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqrano/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cissus erythranos similis hederae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 49, § 82</bibl></cit>.—Hence, † <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrythrănon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqrano/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of ivy with reddish berries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erythras: <entryFree id="n16232" type="main" key="E^ry_^thras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrȳ^thras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eru/qras</foreign>, <sense id="n16232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous king of southern Asia</hi> (Arabia or Persia), <hi rend="ital">after whom the Red Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or the Arabian and Persian Gulfs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were named</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 28, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9</bibl>. —Deriv., </sense><sense id="n16232.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrȳ^thraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Erythraean</hi>: mare, <hi rend="ital">the Red Sea</hi> (pure Lat. Mare rubrum), Mel., Plin., and Curt. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">alga,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the Persian Gulf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapilli,</quote> <trans><tr>pearls</tr>, <tr>fished up in the Persian Gulf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 18</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in a wider sense, <hi rend="ital">Indian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:566" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ivory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:100" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Bacchus in India</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erythrocomos: <entryFree id="n16233" type="greek" key="e^rythro^co^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrythrŏcŏmos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqro/komos</foreign>, <sense id="n16233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red-haired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of pomegranate-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
erythrodanus: <entryFree id="n16234" type="greek" key="e^rythro^da^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrythrŏdănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqro/danon</foreign>, <sense id="n16234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">madder</hi>, Rubia tinctorum, Linn. (pure Lat. rubia); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 56, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
erythros: <entryFree id="n16235" type="greek" key="e^ry_thros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕrȳthros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqro/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 55, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21</bibl></cit>. 31, 105, § 179.</sense></entryFree>
eryx: <entryFree id="n16236" type="main" key="E^ryx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕryx</orth>, <itype>ȳcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/eruc</foreign>, <sense id="n16236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a high mountain in the northwestern angle of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of a city near it famous for its temple of Venus.</hi> According to fable, it was named from the Sicilian king Eryx, son of Butes and Venus, and brother of Aeneas; the mountain is now called <hi rend="ital">S. Giuliano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 420</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:874" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 874</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 570</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">419</bibl>; 630; 772; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 260" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 260</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">The mountain</hi> is also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrycus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (mons), <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 43</bibl> (and perh. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl>).—Deriv., </sense><sense id="n16236.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕrycīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Erycinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 757</bibl></cit> Heyne: Venus, Cic. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:17" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Verr. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:2:2:8" default="NO">2, 2, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30</bibl> and 31; 40, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:871 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 871 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:160" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 12, 6 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sicilian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thapsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 919</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Erycīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 363</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Erycīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city Eryx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
esaias: <entryFree id="n16237" type="main" key="E_^sa_i^a_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ē^sāĭās</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Heb.</etym>, <sense id="n16237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Jewish prophet Isaian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 11, 10</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 524.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēsāĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Isaiah</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Ep. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
esca: <entryFree id="n16238" type="main" key="esca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">esca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n16238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> escas, Liv. Andron. <pb n="660" /> <cb n="ESCU" /> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for edca, v. esco, and edo; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 84</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, both of men and beasts (class.; cf.: victus, cibus, cibaria, alimenta, edulia, opsonium, pulmentum; epulae, daps, etc.). </sense><sense id="n16238.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n16238.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii nec escis aut potionibus vescuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 72</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 475</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 47, 71, § 154</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16238.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun' vetule, auriculis alienis colligis escas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16238.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">bait</hi> for catching animals. </sense><sense id="n16238.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:56" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16238.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">divine Plato escam malorum appellat voluptatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
escalis: <entryFree id="n16239" type="main" key="esca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">escālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>esca</etym>. <sense id="n16239.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to food</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum (with potorium),</quote> <trans><tr>eatingvessels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:10:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16239.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to bait</hi>: vulnus, Poët. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 2, p. 453</bibl> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
escarius: <entryFree id="n16240" type="main" key="esca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">escārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n16240.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=120" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 120</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=77:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 77, 11</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 198</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32:section=2" default="NO">34, 2, 32, § 2</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">escāria</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <trans><tr>fit for eating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n16240.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to bait</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
escatilis: <entryFree id="n16241" type="main" key="esca_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">escātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">edible</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
escendo: <entryFree id="n16242" type="main" key="e_scendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-scendo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exs-</orth>), <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [scando]. </sense><sense id="n16242.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to climb up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi> from a place (cf. ascendo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; also: scando, peto, incedo, ingredior; rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n16242.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n16242.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto puteo ad summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rotam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit> Klotz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in malum (navis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 6</bibl></cit> Nipperd. (for the more usual conscendo).—</sense><sense id="n16242.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad nos contemptus Samnitium pervenit, supra non escendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16242.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., = <foreign lang="greek">a)nabai/nein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to go up</hi> from <hi rend="ital">the sea-coast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergamum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati Delphos cum escendissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16242.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">pars equos escendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rostra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
escensio: <entryFree id="n16243" type="main" key="e_scensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēscensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>escendo</etym>, <sense id="n16243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ascension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mounting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus regem escensionem a Paesto facientem pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agrum Uticensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 29, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 17, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 28, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16243.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a disembarkation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">landing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab navibus in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis escensionem ad populandum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
escensus: <entryFree id="n16244" type="hapax" key="e_scensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēscensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mounting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascending</hi>, only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl> Nipperd. (al. ascensu).</sense></entryFree>
eschara: <entryFree id="n16245" type="greek" key="escha^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eschăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)sxa/ra</foreign>. <sense id="n16245.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The base</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pedestal of a military engine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16245.1" n="II" level="1"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a scar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
escharosis: <entryFree id="n16246" type="greek" key="escha^ro_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eschărōsis</orth>, <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)sxa/rwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n16246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the formation of a scab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:118" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
escharoticus: <entryFree id="n16247" type="main" key="escha^ro_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eschărōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eschara</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)sxarwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing a scar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escharotic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
escifer: <entryFree id="n16248" type="hapax" key="esci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">escĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>esca-fero</etym>, <sense id="n16248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">food-bringing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 19, 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
escit: <entryFree id="n16249" type="main" key="escit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">escit</orth>, <itype>for erit</itype>, v. sum <sense id="n16249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
esco: <entryFree id="n16250" type="hapax" key="esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">esco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>for edsco, from edo, Corss. Ausspr. 2, 257</etym>, <sense id="n16250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">escandi gratia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
esculentus: <entryFree id="n16251" type="main" key="escu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">escŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit for eating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eatable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esculent;</hi> cf. poculentus: <cit><quote lang="la">frusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; Scaev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3</bibl>. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: animalia (with innocua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:50" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ōs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>filled with food</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 90</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: a vino et esculentioribus <cb n="ESUR" /> cibis abstinere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">more delicate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
esculetum: <entryFree id="n16252" type="main" key="escu^le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">escŭlētum, escŭlĕus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">escŭlīnus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">escŭlus</orth>, v. aesc-.</entryFree>
escunt: <entryFree id="n16253" type="main" key="escunt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">escunt</orth>, <itype>for erunt</itype>, v. sum <sense id="n16253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
esito: <entryFree id="n16254" type="main" key="e_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. edo</etym>, <sense id="n16254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be wont to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:10" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 10</bibl></cit> (cited in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 1</bibl> and 9.</sense></entryFree>
esor: <entryFree id="n16255" type="hapax" key="e_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eater</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandiorum optimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Fer. Alsiens. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Fer. Alsiens. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
esox: <entryFree id="n16256" type="greek" key="e^sox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕsox</orth>, <itype>ŏcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/soc</foreign>, <sense id="n16256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish of the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of pike</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 44</bibl> (dub. Jan. isox).</sense></entryFree>
esquiliae: <entryFree id="n16257" type="main" key="Esqui^li^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Esquĭlĭae</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Exqui-liae</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Aesquiliae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. from aesculus, a kind of oak</etym>, <sense id="n16257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the largest of the seven hills of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with several separate heights</hi> (whence the plur. form); <hi rend="ital">added to the city by Servius Tullius; now the heights of Santa Maria Maggiore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 49</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:246" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 246</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 601</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 23, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 51</bibl> et saep. In earlier times low people were buried there; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: atrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16257.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv., </sense><sense id="n16257.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Esquĭlĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Exq-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Esquiline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons, i. q. Esquiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:435" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 435</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16257.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Esquĭlīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Exq-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 45</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; also simply, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Esquilina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: alites, i. e. <hi rend="ital">birds of prey</hi> (which devoured the bodies of criminals executed on the Esquiline), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:100" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 100</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">veneficium (for which human bones, etc., were brought from the Esquiline),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 58</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16257.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Esquĭlĭārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Exq-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Esquiline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
esseda: <entryFree id="n16258" type="main" key="esse^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">essĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. essedum.</entryFree>
essedarius: <entryFree id="n16259" type="main" key="esse^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">essĕdārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>essedum</etym>, <sense id="n16259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a war-chariot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">essedari-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n16259.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fighter in a</hi> (Gallic or British) <hi rend="ital">war-chariot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16259.2" n="II" level="1"> In the Roman circus, <hi rend="ital">a gladiator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2566</bibl>; v. essedum.</sense></entryFree>
essedones: <entryFree id="n16260" type="main" key="Esse_do^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Essēdŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)esshdo/nes</foreign>, <sense id="n16260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian people on the river Tanais</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88 al.</bibl>† † <orth extent="full" lang="la">essĕdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (in the poets, on account of the metre, as <number>plur.</number> only: <orth extent="full" lang="la">esseda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">essĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">essedas transcurrentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: bigae, quadrigae) [a Celtic word], <hi rend="ital">a two-wheeled war-chariot</hi> of the Gauls and Britons (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">raeda, cisium, currus, vehiculum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 16, 2</bibl>; 5, 19, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 204</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">afterwards also among the Romans for pomp and show, and in sham fights,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:76" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:5" default="NO">2, 32, 5</bibl> (3, 30, 5 M.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 192 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
essentia: <entryFree id="n16261" type="main" key="essenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">essentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sum</etym>, <sense id="n16261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the being</hi> or <hi rend="ital">essence</hi> of a thing; transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou)si/a</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec interpretatio (rhetorices) non minus dura est, quam illa Flavii essentia atque entia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:23" default="NO">3, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:33" default="NO">8, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio, propitiis auribus tuis, essentiam dicere. Ciceronem auctorem hujus verbi habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
essentialiter: <entryFree id="n16262" type="main" key="essenti^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">essentĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>essentia</etym>, <sense id="n16262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">essentially</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Trin. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Trin. 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
essui: <entryFree id="n16263" type="main" key="Essu^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Essŭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perhaps identical with the</hi> Esubii and Sesuvii, <hi rend="ital">west of the</hi> Sequana, acc. to G. Long, in the modern <hi rend="ital">diocese of Séez</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
estrix: <entryFree id="n16264" type="hapax" key="estrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">estrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>esor</etym>, <sense id="n16264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female glutton</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gormandizer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
estur: <entryFree id="n16265" type="main" key="e_stur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēstur</orth>, <itype>for editur</itype>, v. 1. ĕdo <sense id="n16265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
esubii: <entryFree id="n16266" type="main" key="Esubi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Esubĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n16266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic tribe west of the</hi> Sequana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; prob. the same as Essui, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
esurialis: <entryFree id="n16267" type="hapax" key="e_su^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>esuries</etym>, <sense id="n16267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to hunger</hi>, comic.: venter gutturque resident esuriales ferias, <hi rend="ital">are keeping hunger-holidays</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">have nothing to eal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">quoted,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Fer. Aliens. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Fer. Aliens. 3</bibl></cit>. <cb n="ET" /></sense></entryFree>
esurienter: <entryFree id="n16268" type="main" key="e_su^ri^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n16268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hungrily</hi>, v. I. esurio <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
esuries: <entryFree id="n16269" type="main" key="e_su^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. esurio</etym>, <sense id="n16269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hunger</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n16269.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 125, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 28, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16269.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">avida ignorantiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
esurigo: <entryFree id="n16270" type="hapax" key="e_su^ri_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hunger</hi>, Var. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 106, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
esurio: <entryFree id="n16271" type="main" key="e_su^ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ess-</orth>), no <sense id="n16271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ītum, īre (<hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> esuribo, Pompon. and Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 479 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:v. 64" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> v. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:v. 22" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> v. 22</bibl> Rib.), <hi rend="ital">v. desid. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. edo], <hi rend="ital">to desire to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffer hunger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be hungry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hunger.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16271.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 6</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 93</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">esuriendi semper inexplebilis aviditas,</quote> <trans><tr>canine hunger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 54, 118, § 283</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. fut. act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(spes est) nos esurituros satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil ibi, quod nobis esuriatur, erit,</quote> <trans><tr>which I should long for</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16271.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera esuriunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>imbibe the color</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 39, 64, § 138</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16271.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi divitiis opus est, quae esurire cogunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 134</bibl></cit> (dub. Jan. usurpasset).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrĭen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hungrily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16272" type="main" key="e_su^ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ess-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. esurio</etym>, <sense id="n16272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hungry person</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 2</bibl>.—In a punning jest, with saturio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
esuritio: <entryFree id="n16273" type="main" key="e_su^ri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hungering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunger</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:100" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 100</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
esuritor: <entryFree id="n16274" type="hapax" key="e_su^ri_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsŭrītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hungry person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 14, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
esus: <entryFree id="n16275" type="main" key="e_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. 1. edo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16276" type="main" key="e_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. edo</etym>, <sense id="n16276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eating</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">esui condi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esui dare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 69, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esui esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esum et potum eximere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16276.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 5, 258</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16277" type="main" key="E_sus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hēsus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom human blood was offered</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1993</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 445</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
et: <entryFree id="n16278" type="main" key="e^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕt</orth>, <sense id="n16278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [Sanscr. ati, beyond; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/ti</foreign>, besides, yet; Lat. et-iam, at-avus], serves to connect, in the most general manner, single words or entire sentences, <hi rend="ital">and.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16278.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: qui illius impudentiam norat et duritudinem, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 20</bibl>: te sale nata precor, Venus et genetrix patris nostri, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 16</bibl> (Ann. v. 53 ed. Vahlen): blande et docte percontat, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quoad possem et liceret, a senis latere numquam discederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo praeclare et multa praecipiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui filium consularem clarum virum et magnis rebus gestis amisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">major (frater) et qui prius imperitarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pueris et mulierculis et servis et servorum simillimis liberis esse grata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">salicta locis aquosis, humectis, umbrosis, propter amnes ibi seri oportet. Et id videto, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime vero, frater: et fleri sic decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua de re est igitur inter summos viros major dissensio? Et omitto illa, quae relicta jam videntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n16278.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16278.3" n="A" level="2"> To subjoin a word or phrase which more accurately defines or more briefly comprehends what goes before, <hi rend="ital">and indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and moreover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and that too</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te enim jam appello, et ea voce, ut me exaudire possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at laudat, et saepe, virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id, et facile, effici posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errabas, Verres, et vehementer errabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with a repetition of the same word: hostis et hostis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">51: tenetur, judices, et manifeste tenetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>, § 152; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 61 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Clem. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Clem. 15</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nostra ut exigua et minima contemnimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla enim nobis societas cum tyrannis, et potius summa distractio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: cur eo non estis contenti? et cur id potius contenditis, quod? <pb n="661" /> <cb n="ET" /> etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te ipse et tuas cogitationes et studia perspexeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omitto illa, quae relicta jam videntur, et Herillum, qui in cognitione et scientia summum bonum ponit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani, quibus Poeni et Hannibal in cervicibus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiose ab his siderum magnitudines, intervalla, cursus anquirebantur et cuncta caelestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde a Xenocrate et Aristotele et ab illa Platonis familia discreparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">et appetendi et refugiendi et omnino rerum gerendarum initia proficiscuntur aut a voluptate aut a dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 42</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16278.4" n="B" level="2"> To connect things similar or dissimilar after the words aeque, par, idem, similis, alius, etc. (more commonly atque, v. atque, I. 2.), <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi aeque amicos et nosmet ipsos diligamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>, v. aeque: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fuisse in Themistocle paria et in Coriolano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tu mihi es germanus pariter corpore et animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius eadem hora Interamnae fuerat et Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eodem tempore Caesari referebantur, et legati veniebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similem sibi videri vitam hominum et mercatum eum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neu simili forma et quom, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl></cit> and 420: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ratione alia, et cum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim alia causa est aequitatis in uno servo et in pluribus,</quote> <trans><tr>than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 20, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter doctos (loqui) et indoctos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16278.5" n="C" level="2"> To connect two immediately successive points of time (only in poets and historians, esp. since the Aug. per.; cf. atque, II. C.), often to be rendered in English by <hi rend="ital">when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and then</hi>: advenit, et navibu' complevit litora, Poeta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit, et extemplo ... sensit medios delapsus in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit (dixerat), et,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 402</bibl></cit>; 2, 705; 3, 258; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:569" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 569</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:120 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 120 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec plura effatus et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fatus et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:773" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec longum tempus et ingens exiit arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:300" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 300</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix prima inceperat aestas, Et pater Anchises dare fatis vela jubebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vix ... et,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 858</bibl></cit>; 6, 498; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:293" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 293</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vixdum ... et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: simul haec effatur, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 246</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16278.6" n="D" level="2"> After an imperative, to subjoin the consequence of an action (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose), <hi rend="ital">and then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic quibus in terris, et eris mihi magnus Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 14, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:515" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Clem. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Clem. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:43:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 43, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 6</bibl>: sit mihi, quod nunc est, etiam minus; <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi vivam Quod superest aevi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16278.7" n="E" level="2"> To subjoin the minor proposition (assumptio or propositio minor) in a syllogism, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi> (cf. atque, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">eorum, qui videntur, alia vera sunt, alia falsa: et quod falsum, id percipi non potest: nullum igitur est, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 13, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:33 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 33 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16278.8" n="F" level="1"> With an accessory affirmative notion, <hi rend="ital">and in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and so</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa me sollicitant ... et sexcenta sunt, Cic. Att! 2, 19: et sunt illa sapientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et erat, ut retuli, clementior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: jam pridem a me illos abducere Thestylis orat; <cit><quote lang="la">Et faciet, quoniam sordent tibi munera nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 44</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">estne ille noster Parmeno? et certe ipsus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16278.9" n="G" level="1"> To subjoin an emphatic question or exclamation: <cit><quote lang="la">et sunt qui de via Appia querantur, taceant de curia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:39:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 39, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 40, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:338 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 338 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et his tot criminibus testimoniisque convictus in eorum tabella spem sibi aliquam proponit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:28:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:89" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 89</bibl>.—Esp. with <hi rend="ital">quisquam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quisquam dubitabit quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 42</bibl></cit> Matthiae; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 1 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n16278.10" n="H" level="1"> To connect an idea as either homogeneous or complementary to that which precedes, <hi rend="ital">and so too</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and moreover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and at the same time; too</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi> <cb n="ET" /> (hence, often in Liv., Curt., and late Lat., rarely in Cic., = etiam; cf. Anton. Stud. pp. 26-69; <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 420): Terentia te maxime diligit salutemque tibi plurimam ascribit, et Tulliola, deliciae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.: Ge.</hi> Salvus sis. <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Et tu salve, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 122</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: salve et tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa mihi sunt voluptati: et erant illa Torquatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tunc eras? Romae. Verum quid ad rem? et alii multi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ib. § 94: et illud videndum quanto magis homines mala fugiant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi sunt vires, et mihi facta tuba'st!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil verius. Probe et ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 73</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">et ille,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 24</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simul et ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">57, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul et iste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc ego amore pereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: nunc et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meruit et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam formam cepi hujus in me et statum, Decet et facta moresque hujus habere me similes item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et qui parat pecus, necesse est constituat numerum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">nam et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 19 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 107</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with a preceding non modo or non solum (post-Aug.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 15, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et ... non = ne ... quidem, ego vero et in ipsa suffocatione non desii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 54:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 54, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16278.11" n="I" level="1"> When repeated, et ... et, it serves, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kai\ ... kai/</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">te kai/</foreign>, to connect two ideas partitively, <hi rend="ital">both ... and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as well ... as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not only ... but also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc etiam ad malum accersebatur malum, Et discipulus et magister perhibebantur improbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et audax et malus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquere utrumque nobis, et quid tibi est, et quid velis nostram operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut et severitas adhibeatur et contumelia repellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimitto (puerum), et ut a magistris ne abducam et quod mater discedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non et legatum argentum est et non est legata numerata pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 13</bibl></cit> et saep. More than twice: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facilius et hujus hominis innocentissimi miserias et illorum audaciam cognoscere possitis et rei publicae calamitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so three times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">six times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ten times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl></cit>.—With a subordinate <hi rend="ital">que</hi> or <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et semper me coluit diligentissimeque observavit et a studiis nostris non abhorret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with atque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 95</bibl></cit>.—Et ... que are sometimes used for et ... et (rarely in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in Liv. and post-Aug. writers): quis est quin intellegat et eos inmemores fuisse, nosque honestate duci?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:302" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 88, 302</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id et singulis universisque semper honori fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 46</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 24, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 32, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33 al.</bibl>—Sometimes the second et subjoins a more weighty assertion; in which case et ... et = cum ... tum, <hi rend="ital">not only ... but also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo et in aliis causis exercitatus et in hac multum et saepe versatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16278.12" n="2" level="3"> Et ... neque or neque ... et, when one clause is a negative (but et ... et non, et non ... et, when only one word is negatived): <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero et exspectabo ea quae polliceris neque exigam, nisi tuo commodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego si et Silius is fuerit, quem tu putas nec Drusus facilem se praebuerit, Damasippum velim aggrediare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui quidem ita sunt Stoici assensi, ut et, quicquid honestum esset, id utile esse censerent, nec utile quicquam, quod non honestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: pueris nobis Cn. Aufidius praetorius et in senatu sententiam dicebat nec amicis deliberantibus<cb n="ETHN" />  deerat et Graecam scribebat historiam et videbat in litteris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia et consul aberat ... nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec miror et gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam nec in eo jus cognationis servavit, cui ademit regnum, et eum, cui dedit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id et nobis erit perjucundum et tibi non sane devium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus is melior, quem et non coquit sol et tangit ros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R.
