cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orae Cumarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Sibylla,</quote> <trans><tr>the Cumaean Sibyl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:30" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Cumaean Sibyl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:257" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulveris anni,</quote> <trans><tr>the great age of the Sibyl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:126" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 126</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 136</bibl>: talentum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=78:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 78, 14</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n16313.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euboeüs</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Euboean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:137" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16313.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eubŏïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:414" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the region about Cumae</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:263" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 263</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eubolion: <entryFree id="n16314" type="main" key="eubo^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eubŏlĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. dictamnus, <sense id="n16314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant dittany</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eubuleus: <entryFree id="n16315" type="greek" key="Eubu_leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eubūleus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Anaces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Dioscuri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eubulidas: <entryFree id="n16316" type="greek" key="Eubu_li^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eubūlĭdas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
euchadia: <entryFree id="n16317" type="greek" key="Euchadia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euchadia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n16317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eucharis: <entryFree id="n16318" type="greek" key="eucha^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euchăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/xaris</foreign>, <sense id="n16318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grateful</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eucharistia: <entryFree id="n16319" type="greek" key="eucha^risti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euchăristĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)xaristi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n16319.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A thanksgiving</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 47</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16319.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Lord's supper</hi> in the Christian Church, <hi rend="ital">the eucharist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eucharisticon: <entryFree id="n16320" type="greek" key="eucha^risti^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euchăristĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)xaristiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n16320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thanksgiving</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. Haeret. 47</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the name of a poem of thanks addressed by Statius to the Emperor Domitian,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
euclides: <entryFree id="n16321" type="main" key="Eucli_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euclīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)klei/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n16321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Euclid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16321.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A philosopher of Megara</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Socrates and founder of the Megaric sect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16321.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mathematician in Alexandria under Ptolemy Philadelphus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eucnemos: <entryFree id="n16322" type="main" key="eucne_mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eucnēmos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/knhmos</foreign>, <sense id="n16322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with beautiful legs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eudaemon: <entryFree id="n16323" type="greek" key="Eudaemon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eudaemon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>com.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)dai/mwn</foreign> (fortunate), <sense id="n16323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek appellation of the southern part of Arabia</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Arabia Felix</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">and of its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eudemus: <entryFree id="n16324" type="main" key="Eude_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eudēmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/dhmos</foreign>, <sense id="n16324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">a Greek physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eudiaeon: <entryFree id="n16325" type="gloss" key="eudiaeon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eudiaeon</orth> <itype>lineum filum, quod medici extremo in clysterio relinquunt</itype>, per quod <foreign lang="greek">klusmo/s</foreign> emittitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=78:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 78, 13</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
eudoses: <entryFree id="n16326" type="main" key="Eudoses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eudoses</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <sense id="n16326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe of Germany</hi>, mentioned only by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eudoxus: <entryFree id="n16327" type="main" key="Eudoxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eudoxus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/docos</foreign>, <sense id="n16327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek astrologer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Plato</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
euenus: <entryFree id="n16328" type="main" key="Eue_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euēnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-nos</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēvēnus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/hnos</foreign>, <sense id="n16328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Etolia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Marpessa; in despair at the loss of whom he threw himself into the river Lycormas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 242" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16328.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The river formerly called Lycormas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now the Fidari</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 11</bibl>.—Deriv.. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euēnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the river Evenus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 528</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euerganeus: <entryFree id="n16329" type="greek" key="euerga^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euergănĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">eu)ergo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n16329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well-wrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-joined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
euethes: <entryFree id="n16330" type="main" key="eue_thes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euēthes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)h(qhs</foreign> (good-natured, hence), <sense id="n16330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi> (pure Lat. stultus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eugalacton: <entryFree id="n16331" type="main" key="euga^lacton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eugălacton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)ga/lakton</foreign>, <sense id="n16331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name of the plant glaux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 58, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euganei: <entryFree id="n16332" type="main" key="Euga^ne^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eugănĕi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of northern Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n16332.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eugăneus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> Euganei, <hi rend="ital">Euganean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:25:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
euge: <entryFree id="n16333" type="greek" key="euge^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eugĕ</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">eugē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">eugae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 8</bibl>), <pos>interj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)=ge</foreign>, an exclamation of joy, applause, admiration, etc., <sense id="n16333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well done! good! bravo!</hi> (cf. eu; freq. in Plaut. and Ter., and <pb n="664" /> <cb n="EUNU" /> in the Vulg.). </sense><sense id="n16333.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">euge, euge, perbene, Ab saxo avortit fluctus ad litus scapham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 20</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:167" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:75" default="NO">1, 75</bibl>; as an indecl. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">euge tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">euge,</quote> <trans><tr>well done</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:34:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 34, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 25, 21</bibl>.—So, <orth extent="full" lang="la">eugepae</orth> (contracted from euge papae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16333.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., with an ironical signif. superadded, <hi rend="ital">excellent! admirable!</hi> euge, optime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 13</bibl>. V. Hand, Turs. II. p. 610 sq.</sense></entryFree>
eugeneus: <entryFree id="n16334" type="greek" key="euge^ne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eugĕnēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)genh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well-born</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generous;</hi> applied to wine of good quality: <cit><quote lang="la">(vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(uvae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eugepae: <entryFree id="n16335" type="main" key="euge^pae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eugĕpae</orth>, v. euge, I.</entryFree>
euhan: <entryFree id="n16336" type="main" key="Euhan"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euhan</orth> (cf. Lach. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 743</bibl>; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euan</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1, 29</bibl>; not <orth extent="full" lang="la">Evan</orth>, as in many edd.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)a/n</foreign>, <sense id="n16336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 742</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">euhans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">eu)a/zwn</foreign>), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">crying Euhan!</hi> an epithet of the Bacchantes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:101" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 18</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">euhantes orgia,</quote> <trans><tr>celebrating the rites of Bacchus with the cry Euhan!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 517</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
euhemerus: <entryFree id="n16337" type="main" key="Euhe_me^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euhēmĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)h/meros</foreign>, <sense id="n16337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek poet and philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 33 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
euhius: <entryFree id="n16338" type="main" key="Euhius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euhius</orth> (cf. Lach. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 743</bibl>; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euius</orth>; less correctly, as in some edd., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Evius</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 742</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 25, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 17</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 424.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Euhion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:102" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 563</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Euhie, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 72</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 224.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16338.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euhius</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Evius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga, i. e. tympana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16338.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euhĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Bacchante</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euhoe: <entryFree id="n16339" type="main" key="euhoe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euhoe</orth> (dissyl.; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">euoe</orth>; less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvoe</orth>; cf. Lach. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 743</bibl>), <pos>interj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)oi=</foreign>, <sense id="n16339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shout of joy at the festivals of Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">euhoe Bacche,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 563</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 389</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 5</bibl> and 7; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">euhan euhoe euhoe euhius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Tr. 150</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
euhydrium: <entryFree id="n16340" type="main" key="Euhy_dri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euhȳdrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n16340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euias: <entryFree id="n16341" type="main" key="Euias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euias</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. Euhius.</entryFree>
eumaeus: <entryFree id="n16342" type="main" key="Eumaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eumaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/maios</foreign>, <sense id="n16342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the swineherd of Ulysses in Homer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 126" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eumeces: <entryFree id="n16343" type="greek" key="eume_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eumēces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)mh=kes</foreign> (very long). <sense id="n16343.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of balsam-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16343.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An unknown gem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eumedes: <entryFree id="n16344" type="main" key="Eume_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eumēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)mh/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n16344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Trojan herald</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Dolon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 346</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eumelus: <entryFree id="n16345" type="main" key="Eume_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eumēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/mhlos</foreign>. <sense id="n16345.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Patrae</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 390</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16345.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Aeneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 665</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eumenes: <entryFree id="n16346" type="main" key="Eume^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eumĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)me/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n16346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous general under Alexander the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and after his death governor of Cappadocia</hi>, Nep. Eum.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eumenides: <entryFree id="n16347" type="main" key="Eume^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eumĕnĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)meni/des</foreign> (the benevolent, the gracious ones), a euphemistic name for <sense id="n16347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Furies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 278</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 483</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:469 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 469 al.</bibl>—In the <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eumenis</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a Fury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:559" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 559</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:423" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 423</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eumetria: <entryFree id="n16348" type="greek" key="eume_^tri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eumē^trĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)metri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n16348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 2, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eumitres: <entryFree id="n16349" type="greek" key="eumitres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eumitres</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eumolpus: <entryFree id="n16350" type="main" key="Eumolpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eumolpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/molpos</foreign>, <sense id="n16350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous Thracian singer and priest of Ceres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who brought the Eleusinian mysteries and the culture of the vine to Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 199</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">His descendant of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Musaeus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 93</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A sacerdotal family in Athens</hi> also bore, after him, the name <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eumolpĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*eu)molpi/dai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
euneos: <entryFree id="n16351" type="main" key="eune^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eunĕos</orth>, <itype>false reading for eureos</itype>, q. v.).</entryFree>
eunuchinus: <entryFree id="n16352" type="main" key="eunu_chi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eunūchīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eunuchus</etym>, <cb n="EUPL" /> <sense id="n16352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a eunuch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eunuchion: <entryFree id="n16353" type="greek" key="eunu_chi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eunūchĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)nou/xion</foreign>, <sense id="n16353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lettuce that subdues amatory desires</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eunuchismus: <entryFree id="n16354" type="greek" key="eunu_chismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eunūchismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)nouxismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unmanning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:118" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eunuchizatus: <entryFree id="n16355" type="greek" key="eunu_chi_za_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eunūchīzātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [<foreign lang="greek">eu)nouxizw</foreign>], <sense id="n16355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made a eunuch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutilated</hi>, Hier. contr. Jov. 1, 7.</sense></entryFree>
eunucho: <entryFree id="n16356" type="hapax" key="eunu_cho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eunūcho</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>eunuchus</etym>, <sense id="n16356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a eunuch of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unman</hi>: se, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 106, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eunuchus: <entryFree id="n16357" type="greek" key="eunu_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eunūchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)nou=xos</foreign>, <sense id="n16357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a eunuch.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16357.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:366" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:378" default="NO">378</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:35" default="NO">12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 37, 36</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16357.2" n="II" level="1"> (Sc. fabula.) <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of one of Terence's comedies.</hi></sense></entryFree>
euoe: <entryFree id="n16358" type="main" key="euoe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euoe</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">euhoe</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, v. euhoe.</entryFree>
euonymos: <entryFree id="n16359" type="greek" key="euo_ny^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euōnymos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/wnumos</foreign> (of good, prosperous name), <sense id="n16359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a tree</hi> (<hi rend="ital">spindle-tree</hi>) <hi rend="ital">in Lesbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 38, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eupalium: <entryFree id="n16360" type="main" key="Eupa^lium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eupălium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)pa/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n16360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of western Locris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8</bibl>.—The same called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eupalia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eupator: <entryFree id="n16361" type="main" key="Eupa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eupător</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)pa/twr</foreign>, <sense id="n16361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Mithridates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eupatoria: <entryFree id="n16362" type="greek" key="eupa^to^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eupătŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)patori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n16362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> agrimonia, <hi rend="ital">agrimony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 29, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eupelios: <entryFree id="n16363" type="greek" key="eupe^li^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eupĕlĭos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)pe/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n16363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> daphnoides, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>; see the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
eupetalos: <entryFree id="n16364" type="greek" key="eupe^ta^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eupĕtălos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)pe/talos</foreign>, <sense id="n16364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the opal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euphonia: <entryFree id="n16365" type="greek" key="eupho_nia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euphōnia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)fwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n16365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">euphony</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> p. 1751</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
euphorbea: <entryFree id="n16366" type="main" key="euphorbe^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euphorbĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n16366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an African plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:77" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7, 38, § 77</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 12, 91, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:118" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 11, 72, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euphorbus: <entryFree id="n16367" type="main" key="Euphorbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euphorbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/forbos</foreign>. <sense id="n16367.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Panthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a brave Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose soul Pythagoras asserted had descended to himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through the process of transmigration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16367.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Greek physician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after whom was named the plant</hi> euphorbea; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euphorio: <entryFree id="n16368" type="main" key="Eupho^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euphŏrĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)fori/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n16368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grammarian and poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born at Chalcis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Euboea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who flourished in the time of Ptolemy Euergetes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 41:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 41, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 70 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
euphranor: <entryFree id="n16369" type="main" key="Euphra_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euphrānor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)fra/nwr</foreign>. <sense id="n16369.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated painter and sculptor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Praxiteles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:128" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:217" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 217</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16369.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An architect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euphrates: <entryFree id="n16370" type="main" key="Euphra_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euphrātes</orth> (in Inscr. also EVFRATES), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)fra/ths</foreign>, <foreign /> <sense id="n16370.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wellknown river in Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rises in Armenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after its junction with the Tigris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empties into the Persian Gulf</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Frat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:5" default="NO">3, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 83</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 562</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:14" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 14</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Euphratē, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 358</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16370.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the dwellers on its banks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 509</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16370.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euphrā-taeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)fratai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of the Euphrates</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Armenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diademata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:122" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16370.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euphrātis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Euphrates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16370.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A philosopher in the time of the younger Pliny</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10</bibl>.—‡ </sense><sense id="n16370.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rare Roman surname</hi>: M. IVNIVS EVFRATES, Inscr. in Bull. dell. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1844, p. 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euphrone: <entryFree id="n16371" type="greek" key="euphro^ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euphrŏne</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)fro/nh</foreign> (the propitious), euphemism for <sense id="n16371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut euethen Graeci dicimus stultum, et noctem euphronen, et furias Eumenidas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. Lidd. and Scott, s. v. <foreign lang="greek">eu)fro/nh</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
euphrosyne: <entryFree id="n16372" type="main" key="Euphro^sy^ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euphrŏsyne</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)frosu/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n16372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the graces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euphrosynum: <entryFree id="n16373" type="greek" key="euphro^sy^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euphrŏsynum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)fro/sunon</foreign>, <sense id="n16373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> buglossos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 40, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euplia: <entryFree id="n16374" type="greek" key="euplia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euplia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n16374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 81, § 130</bibl>. <cb n="EURU" /></sense></entryFree>
euplocamus: <entryFree id="n16375" type="greek" key="euplo^ca^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euplŏcămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)plo/kamos</foreign>, <sense id="n16375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having beautiful locks</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 35, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eupolemus: <entryFree id="n16376" type="main" key="Eupo^le^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eupŏlĕmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)po/lemos</foreign>, <sense id="n16376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eupolis: <entryFree id="n16377" type="main" key="Eupo^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eupŏlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n16377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated comic poet in Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Aristophanes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:66" default="NO">10, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:65 al" default="NO">12, 10, 65 al.</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Eupolin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eupolidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:124" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eupteron: <entryFree id="n16378" type="greek" key="eupte^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euptĕron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/pteron</foreign>, <sense id="n16378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> polytrichon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eureos: <entryFree id="n16379" type="main" key="eure^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurĕos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurinus: <entryFree id="n16380" type="main" key="euri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/rinos</foreign>: <sense id="n16380.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <trans><tr>an east wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
euripice: <entryFree id="n16381" type="greek" key="euri^pi^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurĭpĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)ripikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n16381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 71, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euripides: <entryFree id="n16382" type="main" key="Euri_pi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurīpĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)ripi/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n16382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Athenian tragic poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:67 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 67 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 20</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> Euripidae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16382.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurīpĭdēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Euripides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
euripus: <entryFree id="n16383" type="main" key="euri_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurīpus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/ripos</foreign>, <sense id="n16383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narrow channel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strait.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16383.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n16383.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 97, 100, § 219</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16383.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurīpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/ripos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the channel between Boeotia and Euboea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Egripo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:235 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 235 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16383.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a canal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aqueduct.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16383.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ductus aquarum, quos isti nilos et euripos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 84" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:123" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 24, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n16383.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the trench that ran round the Roman circus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 23</bibl>; cf. Smith's Antiq. p. 53 a.</sense></entryFree>
euroaquilo: <entryFree id="n16384" type="main" key="euro^a^qui^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurŏ-ăquĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the northeast wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:Apost. 27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. Apost. 27, 14</bibl>; cf. the foll. two articles.</sense></entryFree>
euroauster: <entryFree id="n16385" type="gloss" key="euro^auster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurŏ-auster</orth> <itype>dictus, quod ex una parte habeat Eurum, ab altera Austrum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 11, 6</bibl>.</entryFree>
euronotus: <entryFree id="n16386" type="greek" key="euro^no^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurŏ-nŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)ro/notos</foreign>, <sense id="n16386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the south-southeast wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which is between eurus and notus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:42" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
europa: <entryFree id="n16387" type="main" key="Euro_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurōpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurōpe</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)rw/ph</foreign>. <sense id="n16387.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of the Phoenician king Agenor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Sarpedon and Minos by Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under the form of a bull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carried her off to Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:836 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 836 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 155" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:178" default="NO">178</bibl>; <case>nom.</case> Europe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:52" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28, 52</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Europae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Europen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 323</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Europam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16387.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">the portico in the Field of Mars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was adorned with a painting representing the rape of Europa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:20" default="NO">3, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16387.2" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurō-paeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Europa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Minos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16387.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The continent of Europe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after her;</hi> usual form Europa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 662</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3</bibl> prooem. § 3; 3, 1, 1, § 5; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 23, 37, § 121 et saepiss.: Europe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:1" default="NO">2, 1, 1</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Europen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:9" default="NO">2, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16387.4" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n16387.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurōpaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Europe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">European</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16387.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurōpensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aurel. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eurotas: <entryFree id="n16388" type="main" key="Euro_tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurōtas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)rw/tas</foreign>, <sense id="n16388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the principal river of Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the banks of which Sparta stood</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Basilipotamo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 8, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:21:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 21, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 17, 32</bibl> et saep.; <case>nom.</case> Eurōta, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.; acc.</hi> Eurotan, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurotias: <entryFree id="n16389" type="greek" key="euro_ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurōtĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)rwti/as</foreign>, <sense id="n16389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurous: <entryFree id="n16390" type="main" key="euro_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eurus; cf.: arctous, Lesbous</etym>, <sense id="n16390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eastern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 533</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eurus: <entryFree id="n16391" type="greek" key="eurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)=ros</foreign>, <sense id="n16391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the southeast wind</hi> (pure Lat. Vulturnus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:65" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:15" default="NO">5, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; Hor. C <pb n="665" /> <cb n="EUST" /> 1, 28, 25; 2, 16, 24 al.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 339</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">441</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16391.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16391.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The east wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 27</bibl> (opp. Zephyrus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 589</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n16391.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the east</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:539" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 539</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 417</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16391.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wind</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 382</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euryalus: <entryFree id="n16392" type="main" key="Eury^a_lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euryālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)ru/hlos</foreign>, <sense id="n16392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hill near Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16393" type="main" key="Eury^a^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euryălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)ru/alos</foreign>. <sense id="n16393.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A friend of Nisus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 294</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 179</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16393.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:289" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 289</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurydamas: <entryFree id="n16394" type="main" key="Eury^da^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurydămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)ruda/mas</foreign> (the wide-ruling), <sense id="n16394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Hector</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 329</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurydica: <entryFree id="n16395" type="main" key="Eury^di^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurydĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)rudi/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n16395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave of Rhea Sylvia</hi>; Euridica, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurydice: <entryFree id="n16396" type="main" key="Eury^di^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurydĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)rudi/kh</foreign>. <sense id="n16396.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Orpheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who died of the bite of a serpent. Orpheus obtained from Pluto permission to bring her back from the Lower World</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under promise that he would not look back at her on the way. But</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as he did not keep this promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she returned to the Lower World</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 31 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 486</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 164" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 164</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16396.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Danaüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurylochus: <entryFree id="n16397" type="main" key="Eury^lo^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurylŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)ru/loxos</foreign>, <sense id="n16397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the only one of the companions of Ulysses who withstood Circe's magic cup</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 252</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">287</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurymedon: <entryFree id="n16398" type="main" key="Eury^me^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurymĕdon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)rume/dwn</foreign>. <sense id="n16398.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Pamphylia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 1015</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16398.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian general in the Peloponnesian war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:7" default="NO">4, 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16398.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Faunus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurymenae: <entryFree id="n16399" type="main" key="Eury^me^nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurymĕnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)rumenai/</foreign>, <sense id="n16399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 25 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurymus: <entryFree id="n16400" type="main" key="Eury^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurymus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/rumos</foreign>, <sense id="n16400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of the seer Telemus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 125" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 125</bibl> and 128.—Whence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurymĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the surname of Telemus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 771</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurynome: <entryFree id="n16401" type="main" key="Eury^no^me"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurynŏme</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)runo/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n16401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Oceanus and Tethys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Leucothoë</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:210 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 210 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eurypylus: <entryFree id="n16402" type="main" key="Eury^py^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurypylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)ru/pulos</foreign>. <sense id="n16402.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Hercules and king of the island of Cos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 363</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n16402.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurypy-lis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Eurypylan</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> i. q. <hi rend="ital">Coan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">textura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 23.—</sense><sense id="n16402.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Euaemon of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and leader of a body of troops before Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 357</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 97" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurysthenes: <entryFree id="n16403" type="main" key="Eurysthe^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurysthĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)rusqe/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n16403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Aristodemus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Sparta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Procles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:191" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurystheus: <entryFree id="n16404" type="main" key="Eurystheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurystheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)rusqeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Sthenelus and grandson of Perseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a king of Mycenae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the command of Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imposed upon Hercules his famous twelve labors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 30</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Eurysthea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 4</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurysthēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Eurysthean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:304" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 304</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurythmia: <entryFree id="n16405" type="greek" key="eurythmi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eurythmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)ruqmi/a</foreign>, in architect., <sense id="n16405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beautiful arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmony</hi> of the parts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eurytus: <entryFree id="n16406" type="main" key="Eury^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurytus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/rutos</foreign>. <sense id="n16406.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">King of Oechalia and father of Iole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 356</bibl>.—Whence <hi rend="ital">Iole</hi> is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurytis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 395</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16406.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 220</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eurytĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 593</bibl> (cf. Hom. Od. 21, 285).—</sense><sense id="n16406.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Argonaut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:439 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 439 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
euscheme: <entryFree id="n16407" type="greek" key="eusche_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euschēmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)sxh/mws</foreign>, <sense id="n16407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">becomingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gracefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsomely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eusebes: <entryFree id="n16408" type="greek" key="euse^bes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eusĕbes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)sebe/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16409" type="main" key="Euse^bes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eusĕbes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)sebh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Ariobarzanes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eusebius: <entryFree id="n16410" type="main" key="Euse^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eusĕbĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n16410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Latin rhetorician</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> p. 191</bibl> Bait.</sense></entryFree>
eustomachus: <entryFree id="n16411" type="greek" key="eusto^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eustŏmăchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)sto/</foreign><foreign lang="greek">maxos</foreign>,<cb n="EVAD" />  <sense id="n16411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good for digesting</hi>, Gargil. 1, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eustylos: <entryFree id="n16412" type="greek" key="eusty_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eustȳlos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/stulos</foreign>, <sense id="n16412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with pillars evenly arranged</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euterpe: <entryFree id="n16413" type="main" key="Euterpe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euterpe</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)te/rph</foreign>, <sense id="n16413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the muse of music</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euthalos: <entryFree id="n16414" type="main" key="euthalos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euthalos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n16414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of laurel</hi>, also called daphnoides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 132</bibl> (al. eupetalos).</sense></entryFree>
eutheriston: <entryFree id="n16415" type="greek" key="euthe^riston"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euthĕriston</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)qe/riston</foreign>, <sense id="n16415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a balsam-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euthia: <entryFree id="n16416" type="greek" key="euthi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euthīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)qei=a</foreign>, <sense id="n16416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a straight line</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 958</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
euthygrammum: <entryFree id="n16417" type="greek" key="euthygrammum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euthygrammum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)qu/grammon</foreign>, <sense id="n16417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an architect's rule</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eutrapelus: <entryFree id="n16418" type="main" key="Eutra^pe^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eutrăpĕlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)tra/pelos</foreign> (witty), <sense id="n16418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname given to P. Volumnius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Marc Antony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eutropius: <entryFree id="n16419" type="main" key="Eutro^pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eutrŏpĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Flavius, <sense id="n16419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman historian in the middle of the fourth century of the Christian era</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with the Emperor Julian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and author of a</hi> Breviarium Historiae Romanae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 36</bibl>; Greg. Naz. Ep. 137 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:46" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 46</bibl> sqq.; cf. Teuffel, Roem. Liter. 936.</sense></entryFree>
euxinus: <entryFree id="n16420" type="main" key="Euxi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Euxīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*eu)/ceinos</foreign> (hospitable), <sense id="n16420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of the Black Sea.</hi> Usually connected with Pontus. In Ovid also freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Euxinum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 6, 46</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 3, 51</bibl>.—And <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Euxīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. Pontus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:197" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 197</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
