euzomon: <entryFree id="n16421" type="greek" key="euzo_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">euzōmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/zwmon</foreign>, <sense id="n16421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of cabbage</hi> (pure Lat. eruca), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 49, § 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eva: <entryFree id="n16422" type="main" key="E_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēva</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Hēva</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 3</bibl> al.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n16422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Eve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first woman</hi>, Tert. Virg. vel. 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamort. 741</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evacuatio: <entryFree id="n16423" type="hapax" key="e_va^cu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvăcŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evacuo</etym>, <sense id="n16423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evacuating;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a weakening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evacuo: <entryFree id="n16424" type="main" key="e_va^cu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-văcŭo</orth>, no <sense id="n16424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to empty out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evacuate</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16424.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:104" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 33, § 104</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16424.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16424.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rid one's self of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay aside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pueruli erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16424.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 43, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evadne: <entryFree id="n16425" type="main" key="E_vadne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēvadne</orth>, v. Euadne.</entryFree>
evado: <entryFree id="n16426" type="main" key="e_va_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vādo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n16426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> evasti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:796" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 796</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> evadi. Treb. Poll. Trig. Tyr. 5, 6), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16426.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go forth</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n16426.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16426.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si (apes) ex alvo minus frequentes evadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex balineis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abiit, excessit, evasit, erupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per praeruptum saxum in Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram,</quote> <trans><tr>to disembark</tr>, <tr>to land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16426.4" n="b" level="4"> In an upward direction: <cit><quote lang="la">ex abditis sedibus evadere atque exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evado ad summi fastigia culminis,</quote> <trans><tr>mount up</tr>, <tr>ascend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in murum, muros, moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cacumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super capita hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16426.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to get away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut e morbo evasurum aegrotum, aut e periculo navem, aut ex insidiis exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: ex fuga, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e manibus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e tanto periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverso colle, sicuti praeceptum fuerat, evadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 50</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16426.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16426.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit, ut eo facilius animus evadat ex hoc aëre eumque perrumpat, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex corpore (animus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 22, 80</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab iis ... evaseris, id Tusc. 1, 41, 98: ad conjecturam,</quote> <trans><tr>to arrive at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in infinitum quaestio evadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16426.8" n="b" level="4"> In an upward direction: <cit><quote lang="la">nitamur semper ad optima: quod facientes aut evademus in summum, aut certe multos infra nos videbimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16426.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to turn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> in some <cb n="EVAG" /> manner, <hi rend="ital">to have an issue</hi> of some kind, <hi rend="ital">to result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">ex communibus proprii, ex fucosis firmi suffragatores evadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 9:35" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 9, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos judicabat non posse oratores evadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit autem Athenis adulescens, perfectus Epicureus evaserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 35, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">87, 299</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita molles mentes evadunt civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis evasit vere indolis regiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tu ejusmodi evasisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis saepe secus videmus evadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 43</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ita fastidiosae mollesque mentes evadant civium, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando aliquod somnium verum evaserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne haec quoque laetitia vana evadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam primum vanum inceptum evasisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 47</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego hercle: sed quo evadas nescio,</quote> <trans><tr>what you are driving at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: quam timeo, quorsum evadas, <hi rend="ital">where you are coming out</hi> in your story, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia illaec licentia Profecto evadet in aliquod magnum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demiror quid sit, et quo evadat, sum in metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videamus, hoc quorsum evadat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huccine (beneficia),</quote> <trans><tr>to end in this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morbos longos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 33, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16426.10" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to come to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be fulfilled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando id, quod somniarimus, evadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: si somnium verum evasit aliquod,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71, 146</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n16426.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; not in Cic.), <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to get over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave behind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16426.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16426.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem videbar evasisse viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot urbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada, arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen harae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibulum (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n16426.14" n="b" level="4"> In an upward direction: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fata gradus evaserat altos,</quote> <trans><tr>had mounted the steps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua,</quote> <trans><tr>to climb</tr>, <tr>ascend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16426.15" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to get away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape from</hi>, = effugere: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnas insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl></cit>: aliquem, Tiber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16426.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16426.17" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: vitam, <hi rend="ital">to depart from</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16426.18" n="b" level="4"> In an upward direction: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec quoque jam lenius supina perseverantibus studiis evaseris,</quote> <trans><tr>hast climbed</tr>, <tr>ascended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16426.19" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get rid of</hi>: aegritudinem, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 294, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravem casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones malignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
evagatio: <entryFree id="n16427" type="hapax" key="e_va^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvăgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evagor</etym>, <sense id="n16427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evaginatio: <entryFree id="n16428" type="hapax" key="e_va_gi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vāgīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evagino</etym>, <sense id="n16428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spreading out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 50</bibl> Orell.</sense></entryFree>
evagino: <entryFree id="n16429" type="main" key="e_va_gi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vāgīno</orth>, no <sense id="n16429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vagina</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to draw out of the scabbard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unsheath</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gladio sua sponte evaginato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 164" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 15, 10</bibl>: pugionem, id. Judith, 13, 9.</sense></entryFree>
evago: <entryFree id="n16430" type="main" key="e_va^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-văgo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>collat. form of <hi rend="ital">depon.</hi> evagor, q. v.</etym>: Famae nam nobilitas late ex stirpe praeclara evagat, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 467, 28</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Trag. p. 219</bibl>).</entryFree>
evagor: <entryFree id="n16431" type="main" key="e_va^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-văgor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n16431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16431.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roam about; to scatter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16431.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne longius evagatae (incubantes gallinae) refrigerent ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cappari evagatur per agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 48, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis ulterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:30:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 30, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16431.3" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to march to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make evolutions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manœuvre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo ad evagandum relicto spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 47, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 47, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16431.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">digress</hi>: qui appetitus longius evagantur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">late evagata est vis morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latissime evagandi sibi viam facere (exempla),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Demostheni permittant evagari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">digressing</hi> in speaking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:25" default="NO">3, 11, 25</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of overstepping the limits of duty: procuratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr 3</bibl></cit> § 9.—* </sense><sense id="n16431.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stray beyond</hi>,<pb n="666" /> <cb n="EVAN" />  <hi rend="ital">to overstep</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evalesco: <entryFree id="n16432" type="main" key="e_va^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vălesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase in strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi> (cf.: vix illa, quae <foreign lang="greek">parago/mena</foreign> vocant, nobis permittimus, sed hoc feliciter, evaluit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 32</bibl>; not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16432.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum evaluissent flagella pedes binos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 15, 25, § 116</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 30, 54, § 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16432.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16432.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuta cura natura magis evalescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: affectatio quietis in tumultum evaluit, <hi rend="ital">strengthened into</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indoles naturalis, adjuta praeceptis, evalescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16432.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16432.5" n="a" level="4"> In the <hi rend="ital">temp. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ability</hi> for any thing, <hi rend="ital">to be able</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne ipsa quidem natura in hoc ita evaluerit, ut non, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: sed non Dardaniae medicari cuspidis ictum Evaluit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 757</bibl>; so with a <hi rend="ital">subjectclause</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:79" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Honor. 303</bibl>; Rapt. Pros. 3, 92. —</sense><sense id="n16432.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To be worth</hi> in price, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16432.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of a word or expression, <hi rend="ital">to prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get into vogue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nationis nomen, non gentis evaluisse paulatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evallo: <entryFree id="n16433" type="main" key="e_vallo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vallo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vallum</etym>, <sense id="n16433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cast out</hi> (only in the foll. passages): nos foras, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 102, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fragm. p. 144</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16434" type="main" key="e_vallo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vallo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. vallus</etym>, <sense id="n16434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to winnow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse from the husks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to husk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hull</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23</bibl>, §§ 97 and 99.</sense></entryFree>
evan: <entryFree id="n16435" type="main" key="E_van"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēvan</orth>, v. Euhan.</entryFree>
evander: <entryFree id="n16436" type="main" key="E_vander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēvander</orth>, <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Euander.</entryFree>
evanesco: <entryFree id="n16437" type="main" key="e_va_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vānesco</orth>, <itype>nŭi, 3</itype> (<sense id="n16437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> evaniturus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vanish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disappear</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16437.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16437.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi cum flos evanuit (with diffugere in auras),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evanescere paulatim et decrescere pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evanescere stinguique colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 828</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>to evaporate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum et salsamentum vetustate,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to lose its strength</tr>, <tr>become vapid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornuaque extremae velut evanescere lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 117</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">et procul in tenuem ex oculis evanuit auram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 658</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:509" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 509</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16437.3" n="2" level="3"> Of persons who flee or hide themselves through fear, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 6, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n16437.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ne cum poëta scriptura evanesceret, <hi rend="ital">to die away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink into oblivion</hi>, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis eorum memoria sensim obscurata est et evanuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae Aristonis, Pyrrhonis (opp. stabilitatem habere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">postea quam extenuari spem nostram et evanescere vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis vis herbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella per taedia et moras (opp. valida impetu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: donatio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to lose its effect</hi> (opp. valere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:11:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 11, § 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">actio dotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:21" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evanescunt haec atque emoriuntur comparatione meliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evangelicus: <entryFree id="n16438" type="greek" key="e_vange^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvangĕlĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">eua-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)aggeliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evangelical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 495</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
evangelista: <entryFree id="n16439" type="greek" key="e_vange^lista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvangĕlista</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">eua-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)aggelisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n16439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evangelist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cathem. 6, 77</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 21, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evangelium: <entryFree id="n16440" type="greek" key="e_vange^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvangĕlĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">eua-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)agge/lion</foreign>. <sense id="n16440.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Good news</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 1</bibl>, written as Greek, <foreign lang="greek">eu)agge/lia</foreign>.—</sense><sense id="n16440.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Gospel</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 23</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
evangelizator: <entryFree id="n16441" type="main" key="e_vange^li_za_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvangĕlīzātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">eua-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>evangelium</etym>, <sense id="n16441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preacher of the Gospel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Praescr. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evangelizo: <entryFree id="n16442" type="main" key="e_vange^li_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvangĕlīzo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">eua-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)aggeli/zw</foreign> (eccl. Lat.). <sense id="n16442.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, always with the accessory notion of <hi rend="ital">bringing good tidings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaiming the Gospel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis gaudium magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christum Iesum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 5, 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 16, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16442.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To evangelize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to win to the Gospel by preaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preach to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 40, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperes evangelizantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:11:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 11, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16442.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="EVEH" /> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim the Gospel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:67:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 67, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 1, 15</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
evanidus: <entryFree id="n16443" type="main" key="e_va_ni^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvānĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>evanesco</etym>, <sense id="n16443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vanishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passing away</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare). </sense><sense id="n16443.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>frail</tr>, <tr>without strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 17, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia vetustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evanida et siticulosa calx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, viriditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16443.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium (with leve),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evanno: <entryFree id="n16444" type="main" key="e_vanno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vanno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vannus</etym>, <sense id="n16444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cast out the chaff of grain from the fan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to winnow.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n16444.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">acus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n16444.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast out</hi>: aliquem, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 23</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fragm. p. 239</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
evans: <entryFree id="n16445" type="main" key="e_vans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. euhan.</entryFree>
evaporatio: <entryFree id="n16446" type="main" key="e_va^po_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvăpōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evaporo</etym>, <sense id="n16446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evaporating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evaporation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:6:13:1" default="NO">6, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evaporativus: <entryFree id="n16447" type="main" key="e_va^po_ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvăpōrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evaporating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt to evaporate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:83" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evaporo: <entryFree id="n16448" type="main" key="e_va^po_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-văpōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disperse in vapor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to evaporate</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 7</bibl> and 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
evasio: <entryFree id="n16449" type="main" key="e_va_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evado</etym>, <sense id="n16449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going out</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 12, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evasto: <entryFree id="n16450" type="main" key="e_vasto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vasto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay utterly waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to devastate</hi> (a favorite word of Livy; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. very rare): omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 37</bibl>; 28, 44; 32, 33, 14 Drak. et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:185" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evax: <entryFree id="n16451" type="main" key="e_vax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvax</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, v. euax.</entryFree>
evectio: <entryFree id="n16452" type="main" key="e_vecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eveho</etym>. * <sense id="n16452.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going upwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flying up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16452.1" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a permit to travel by the public post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a post-warrant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 51, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 55" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evectus: <entryFree id="n16453" type="main" key="e_vectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. eveho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16454" type="main" key="e_vectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>eveho</etym>, <sense id="n16454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exporting</hi> of goods from a place, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 2</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eveho: <entryFree id="n16455" type="main" key="e_ve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĕho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to convey out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead forth</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n16455.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia (signa) ex fanis, ex locis publicis palam plaustris evecta exportataque esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas ex planis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus (with exportare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces (opp. inveho),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 5</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">incaute se evehentes Masinissa excipiebat,</quote> <trans><tr>throwing themselves out</tr>, <tr>rushing out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 27</bibl></cit>.—In an upward direction; palmaque nobilis Terrarum dominos evehit ad deos, <hi rend="ital">raises aloft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevates</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad aethera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16455.2" n="b" level="4"> Reflex., <hi rend="ital">to ride out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">evectus effreno equo,</quote> <trans><tr>springing forwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evecti Aegeo mari Delum trajecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratibus ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ancoras evehi,</quote> <trans><tr>to run foul of the anchors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19</bibl></cit>.— With the <case>acc.</case> of the place: <cit><quote lang="la">evectus os amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16455.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To carry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to convey upwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in collem Esquiliarium eveheretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16455.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16455.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To carry forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel e Piraeeo eloquentia evecta est, omnes peragravit insulas,</quote> <trans><tr>went forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fama ejus evecta insulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe vana evectus,</quote> <trans><tr>carried forwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inconsultius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magicae vanitates in tantum evectae, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evectus sum longius,</quote> <trans><tr>I have made too long a digression</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16455.6" n="B" level="2"> In an upward direction, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to elevate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem usque in tertium consulatum amicitia Principis evexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ad consulatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 13</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium ad summum fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad magnum culmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advanced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliarii in summum evecti fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:53:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 53, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatum supra modum evectae opes,</quote> <trans><tr>increased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 52</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="EVEN" /> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem evehere summis honoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evelatum: <entryFree id="n16456" type="gloss" key="e_ve_la_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvēlātum</orth> <itype>eventilatum, unde velabra, quibus frumenta ventilantur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=77:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 77, 15</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
evello: <entryFree id="n16457" type="main" key="e_vello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vello</orth>, <itype>velli</itype> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), post-class., vulsi (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:38" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. Consol. 16:7 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. Consol. 16, 7 al.</bibl>), <itype>vulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pluck out</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16457.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam se evellisse M. Catoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28</bibl></cit>: ferrum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 25</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">spinas agro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ebulum, cicutam e segete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">55: clavos sepulcris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 15, 44, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam de monumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:12:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorem e turis glebis (with divellere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra obsessa (sc. ex obsidione),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to relieve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:335" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 335</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16457.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drag away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab altari eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: lucos tuos de medio tui, id. Micah, 5, 13.—</sense><sense id="n16457.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">root out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eradicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erase</hi> (a favorite word of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">radicitus mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules non modo ex memoria sed etiam ex fastis evellendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulum ex animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeum severitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem eorum importunitatem ex intimis mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 230</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras (e pectore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:183" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eveninus: <entryFree id="n16458" type="main" key="Eve_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Evēnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Euēnus.</entryFree>
evenio: <entryFree id="n16459" type="main" key="e_ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n16459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praes. subj.</hi> evenat, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">evenant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to come out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16459.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">merses profundo: pulchrior evenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota arundo serius praedicto tempore evenit,</quote> <trans><tr>comes up</tr>, <tr>grows up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine modo rus eveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">evenit sermo Samuelis Israeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n16459.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16459.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fall out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen;</hi> and with alicui, <hi rend="ital">to befall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betide</hi> one (v. 2. accido, II., and 1. contingo, II. B. 3. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">in hominum aetate multa eveniunt hujusmodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:57 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 57 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime id in rebus publicis evenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timebam, ne evenirent ea, quae acciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid homini potest turpius, quid viro miserius aut acerbius usu venire? quod tantum evenire dedecus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (sc. tyrannum) si optimates oppresserunt, quod ferme evenit, habet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod evenit saepius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod plerumque evenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc in hac conformatione rei publicae non sine magnis principum vitiis evenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alia Tusculi, alia Romae eveniat saepe tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quota enim quaeque res evenit praedicta ab istis? aut si evenit quippiam: quid afferri potest, cur non casu id evenerit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pax evenerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had been concluded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ne idem eveniat in meas litteras,</quote> <trans><tr>that the same thing will happen to my letter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it happens</hi> (cf.: accidit, incidit, contigit, obtingit, fit), with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">evenit, senibus ambobus simul Iter ut esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 35</bibl>; Brutus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:5" default="NO">2, 12, 5</bibl> et saep.; with <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507, 20</bibl> (cf. 2. accido): <cit><quote lang="la">ob id, quod furtum fecit servus, evenit, quo minus eum habere domino liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi divitiae evenerunt maxumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">damna evenerunt maxuma misero mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merito sibi ea evenerunt a me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi nihil improviso evenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (improbis) utinam ipsis evenissent ea, quae tum homines precabantur!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 53</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Genucio consuli ea provincia sorte evenit,</quote> <trans><tr>fell to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense without sorte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 41</bibl> et saep.: si quid sibi eveniret, <hi rend="ital">if any thing should happen to himself</hi>, euphemist. for <hi rend="ital">if he should die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 86</bibl> Ruhnk.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si in Pompeio quid humani evenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 5:8, p. 244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 5, 8, p. 244</bibl></cit> ed. Gerl. (v. 2. accido, II.).—</sense><sense id="n16459.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi> (as a consequence) from any thing; <hi rend="ital">to turn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> in any way (cf. evado, I. B. 2.; evado is used both of <pb n="667" /> <cb n="EVEN" /> persons and things, but evenio only of things): <cit><quote lang="la">eventus est alicujus exitus negotii, in quo quaeri solet, quid ex quaque re evenerit, eveniat, eventurum sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nobis haec habitatio bona, fausta, felix fortunataque eveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (auspicia) sibi secunda evenerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 27</bibl></cit> (al. secunde); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta prospera eventura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:47" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam quae occulte tentaverat, aspera foedaque evenerant (opp. prospere cessere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Kritz.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si adversa pugna evenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea res mihi magistratuique bene atque feliciter eveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene ac feliciter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. feliciter, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit> (with cadere); so, <cit><quote lang="la">prospere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">male istis eveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides omnia fere contra ac dicta sint evenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si fors aliter quam voles evenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid praeter spem evenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam haec evenerunt nostra ex sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec blanda dicta quo eveniant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 36</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 118</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēventum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to evenio, II.). </sense><sense id="n16459.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An occurrence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">event.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16459.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">semper me causae eventorum magis movent quam ipsa eventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimorum seculorum et eventorum memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cujusque facti et eventi causa ponetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16459.7" n="2" level="3"> In Lucr. opp. conjunctum, of the external conditions, or <hi rend="ital">accidents</hi>, of persons and things (as poverty, riches, freedom, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:458" default="NO" valid="yes">458</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:467" default="NO" valid="yes">467</bibl>; 470 al.—</sense><sense id="n16459.8" n="3" level="3"> Alicujus, <hi rend="ital">that which befalls one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei qui sciunt quid aliis acciderit, facile ex aliorum eventis suis rationibus possunt providere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te ex nostris eventis communibus admonendum putarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula rerum eventorumque nostrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui omnia pendere ex alterius eventis coguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures aliorum eventis docentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16459.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consequence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi> of an action (cf.: exitus, eventus, successus, obitus, occasus), freq. in Cic., usually <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia eventis ponderare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 41</bibl></cit>; Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 204, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. causae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum praedicta quotidie videat re et eventis refelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eventilo: <entryFree id="n16460" type="main" key="e_venti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-ventĭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n16460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to set in motion</hi> (the air), <hi rend="ital">to fan</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16460.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aërem graviorem) emendant assiduo linteorum jactatu eventilando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: frumenta, <hi rend="ital">to winnow</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to purify by winnowing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 23</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n16460.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes eventilatae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>scattered</tr>, <tr>dissipated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eventum: <entryFree id="n16461" type="main" key="e_ventum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēventum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. evenio <sense id="n16461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eventus: <entryFree id="n16462" type="main" key="e_ventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>evenio, II.</etym>. <sense id="n16462.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An occurrence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">event; fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lot</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi a peritis in Asia praedictum est, fore eos eventus rerum qui acciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in incerto reliqui temporis eventu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 26, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerere hoc ejus (sc. Scipionis) eventu, vereor ne invidi magis quam amici sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 48</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid reliquis acciderit, qui quosque eventus exciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n16462.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The</hi> (<hi rend="ital">lucky</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unlucky</hi>) <hi rend="ital">issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consequence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi> of an action (for syn. cf.: eventum, exitus, successus), in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus est alicujus exitus negotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus magnis memoriaque dignis consilia primum, deinde acta, postea eventus exspectantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 15, 63</bibl></cit>: etiam amplissimorum virorum consilia ex eventu, non ex voluntate a plerisque probari solent, Balbus et Oppius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl> A: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris est poena tristis, et praeter eos eventus, qui sequuntur, per se ipsa maxima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.: semper ad eventum festinat (poëta), <hi rend="ital">to the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue</hi>, <cb n="EVER" /> <hi rend="ital">event</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim rei eventum experiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 42, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B.
