C. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 96, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 123</bibl></cit> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: eventus docet ... stultorum iste magister est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16462.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">good fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egi ego pro Vareno non sine eventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque illi modo cauti prompti post eventum ac magniloqui erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 27</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis jam eventuum, satis casuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16462.3" n="C" level="2"> Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">Bonus Eventus,</quote> <trans><tr>Good Success</tr>, <tr>a guardian deity of the Roman husbandmen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1780 sq.</bibl>; in the <case>dat.</case> also: <cit><quote lang="la">BONO EVENTO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1783</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">DEO SANCTO EVENTO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1785</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evenus: <entryFree id="n16463" type="main" key="E_ve_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēvēnus</orth>, v. Euenus.</entryFree>
everbero: <entryFree id="n16464" type="main" key="e_verbe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-verbĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n16464.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">os oculosque hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pectus suis armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:737" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 866</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare, fluctus remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:13" default="NO">9, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum cursu parum libero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16464.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec taliaque sollicitas ejus aures everberarent,</quote> <trans><tr>kept striking</tr>, <tr>besieged</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum alicujus ad inquirendum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to stimulate</tr>, <tr>excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 7</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, § 20</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
evergo: <entryFree id="n16465" type="hapax" key="e_vergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes nullos apertos evergunt rivos,</quote> <trans><tr>send forth</tr>, <tr>pour forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
everriator: <entryFree id="n16466" type="gloss" key="e_verri^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēverrĭātor</orth> <itype>vocatur, qui jure accepta hereditate justa facere defuncto debet, quae si non fecerit, seu quid in ea re turbaverit</itype>, suo capite luat. Id nomen ductum a verrendo. Nam exverrae sunt purgatio quaedam domus, ex qua mortuus ad sepulturam ferendus est, quae fit per everriatorem certo genere scoparum adhibito, ab extra verrendo dictarum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=77:18 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 77, 18 sq.</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
everriculum: <entryFree id="n16467" type="main" key="e_verri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēverrĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>everro</etym>, <sense id="n16467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sweepnet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag-net.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16467.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., for taking a large number of fishes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 294</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 34</bibl>; and: everriculum, quod Graece <foreign lang="greek">sagh/nh</foreign> dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:13:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 13, § 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16467.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: everriculum malitiarum omnium, <hi rend="ital">the drag-net</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the sweeperaway of all basenesses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl>: quod umquam hujuscemodi everriculum ulla in provincia fuit? i. e. <hi rend="ital">a plunderer</hi>, sarcastically applied to Verres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, 53</bibl>; cf. everro, II.</sense></entryFree>
everro: <entryFree id="n16468" type="main" key="e_verro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-verro</orth>, <itype>verri, versum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweep out</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16468.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus ex aede Vestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 32</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">purgamenta salsamentorum officinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: aedes, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 192, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum stabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">everrere et purgare stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor retibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 285</bibl></cit>, v. verro.—</sense><sense id="n16468.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">cleansing</hi> a wound: <cit><quote lang="la">egestis vel eversis omnibus, quae tumorem moverant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n16468.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to clean out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder completely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in a sarcastic pun applied to Verres: o Verria praeclara! ... quod fanum non eversum atque extersum reliqueris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. everriculum, II.</sense></entryFree>
eversio: <entryFree id="n16469" type="main" key="e_versi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>everto, I. B.</etym>. <sense id="n16469.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16469.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An overthrowing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16469.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">eversiones vehiculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16469.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a destructive overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subversion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 69</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">eversiones urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:16:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16469.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A turning out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expulsion</hi> from one's possession: <cit><quote lang="la">possidentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:13:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16469.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A turning out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expulsion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16469.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">subversion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc rerum publicarum eversiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eversor: <entryFree id="n16470" type="main" key="e_versor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēversor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>everto</etym>, <sense id="n16470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subverter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16470.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginis et Numantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regnorum Priami (Achilles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnorum cometes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>presaging their destruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:639" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 639</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16470.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <cb n="EVID" /> juris humani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>: pecuniae (with interceptor), i. e. <hi rend="ital">who squanders it</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 6, 1.</sense></entryFree>
eversus: <entryFree id="n16471" type="main" key="e_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēversus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n16471.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Swept out</hi>, v. everro.—</sense><sense id="n16471.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Overthrown</hi>, v. everto.</sense></entryFree>
everto: <entryFree id="n16472" type="main" key="e_verto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-verto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>, <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn upside down</hi> (syn. demolior, destruo, extinguo, diruo, deleo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n16472.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16472.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aequora ventis,</quote> <trans><tr>to upturn</tr>, <tr>agitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to plough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:75" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervices,</quote> <trans><tr>to twist</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 131</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—More freq. and class. (not in Caes.), </sense><sense id="n16472.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16472.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overturn</hi> any thing from its position, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naviculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 256</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:31:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56</bibl> § 130; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">poët.: Ismara,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the trees of Ismarus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:107" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 8.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">eversus,</quote> <trans><tr>thrown down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 77, § 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:137" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 13, 85, § 137</bibl>.—Designating the <hi rend="ital">term. ad quem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Athon Pindumve revulsos Sede sua, totos in apertum everteret aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 555</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta in dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 231</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16472.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes (with diripere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditus arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:376" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 376</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16472.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To turn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi> a man from his possession: <cit><quote lang="la">ut agro evortat Lesbonicum, quando evortit aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentem bonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupillum fortunis patriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos fortunis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc funditus bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16472.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (Acc. to I. B.) </sense><sense id="n16472.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imo summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem non judicio neque disceptatione, sed vi atque impressione evertere,</quote> <trans><tr>to ruin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fortunis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caec. 6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caec. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16472.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overthrow completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subvert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditus aratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditus civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eversa per te et perdita civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 500</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditus amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus virtutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum genus hoc regiae civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges, testamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutam philosophiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">definitionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem dictatoriam et disciplinam militarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium,</quote> <trans><tr>to waste</tr>, <tr>squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassos, Pompeios,</quote> <trans><tr>to ruin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 108</bibl></cit>: titulum, <hi rend="ital">to erase</hi>, Capit. Gord. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evestigatus: <entryFree id="n16473" type="main" key="e_vesti_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vestīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vestigo], <sense id="n16473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">traced out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discovered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigated</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evexus: <entryFree id="n16474" type="hapax" key="e_vexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eveho</etym>, <sense id="n16474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rounded off at the top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rounding upwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 816</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evias: <entryFree id="n16475" type="main" key="E_vi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēvĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. Evius, II.</entryFree>
evibro: <entryFree id="n16476" type="main" key="e_vi_bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vībro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n16476.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to swing forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorpiones rotundos lapides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16476.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ad rabiem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evictio: <entryFree id="n16477" type="main" key="e_victi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evinco, II. A. 2.</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n16477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recovering of one's property by a judicial decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recovery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eviction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21</bibl>, tit. 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 45</bibl>, De evictionibus.</sense></entryFree>
evictus: <entryFree id="n16478" type="main" key="e_victus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from evinco.</entryFree>
evidens: <entryFree id="n16479" type="main" key="e_vi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>video</etym>, of things (like perspicuus), <sense id="n16479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi> (good prose; most freq. since the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. perspicuus, manifestus, apertus, dilucidus): flos (lappae) non evidens, sed intus occultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 64, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid est evidens, de quo inter omnes conveniat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuae et evidentes res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">res (opp. dubia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 34</bibl></cit>: causae (opp. obscurae), Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 52, 53, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">portenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> <pb n="668" /> <cb n="EVIN" /> Macc. 15, 35 et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:52 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 52 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 43 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of persons: auctores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the most trustworthy</tr>, <tr>most credible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvĭdenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">evidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifestly</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 29</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:86 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 86 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 5, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 57</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
evidentia: <entryFree id="n16480" type="main" key="e_vi^denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvĭdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evidens</etym>, <sense id="n16480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctness.</hi>—In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicuity;</hi> used by Cicero along with perspicuitas, as a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">e)na/rgeia</foreign>. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:63" default="NO">4, 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:40" default="NO">9, 2, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16480.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna suae ostensionis,</quote> <trans><tr>of his own manifestation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evideor: <entryFree id="n16481" type="main" key="e_vi^de^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĭdĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri, 2</itype>, <sense id="n16481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. pass.</hi> [ex+video], <hi rend="ital">to appear completely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evigesco: <entryFree id="n16482" type="hapax" key="e_vi^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĭgesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lose liveliness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evigilatio: <entryFree id="n16483" type="hapax" key="e_vi^gi^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvĭgĭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evigilo</etym>, <sense id="n16483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a waking up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awakening</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Solil. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Solil. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 17:18:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Civ. D. 17, 18, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evigilo: <entryFree id="n16484" type="main" key="e_vi^gi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĭgĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n16484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16484.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16484.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To wake up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:128" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:28:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 28, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16484.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be wakeful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigilant.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo evigilaverunt curae et cogitationes meae, si? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16484.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass without sleeping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox evigilanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16484.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to elaborate carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi> (cf. elucubro). </sense><sense id="n16484.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:108" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n16484.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia evigilata cogitationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: etsi nobis, qui id aetatis sumus, evigilatum ferest, tamen, etc., <hi rend="ital">we have nearly done with watching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caring for ourselves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:29:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 29, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evigoratus: <entryFree id="n16485" type="main" key="e_vi^go_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĭgōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vigoro], <sense id="n16485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of vigor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liveliness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evilesco: <entryFree id="n16486" type="main" key="e_vi_lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vīlesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n16486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become vile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despicable</hi> (post - Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nullis sordibus pretium carae pietatis evilescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter quae usque eo eviluit, ut passim ac propalam contemptui esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evincio: <entryFree id="n16487" type="main" key="e_vinci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vincĭo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wind round with something</hi> (not ante-Aug., and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">simul diademate caput Tiridatis evinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 43</bibl>.—More freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridi Mnestheus evinctus oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 494</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">palmae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wound round with the cestus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae (sc. vittā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evincta pudicā Fronde manus,</quote> <trans><tr>crowned with laurel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:554" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 554</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. respectiv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puniceo stabis suras evincta cothurno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 269</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">774</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 676</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16487.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">evincta lacerandum traditi dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:48" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. victa).</sense></entryFree>
evinco: <entryFree id="n16488" type="main" key="e_vinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vinco</orth>, <itype>vici, victum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (not anteAug.). <sense id="n16488.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To overcome completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">evicit omnia assuetus praedae miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbelles, Aeduos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16488.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis evicta,</quote> <trans><tr>overcome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore,</quote> <trans><tr>to induce</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:688" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 688</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandimentis vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 49</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in gaudium evicta domus,</quote> <trans><tr>moved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad miserationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppositas moles gurgite (amnis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 497</bibl></cit>.—Of dangerous places, <hi rend="ital">to pass by in safely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Charybdin remis (rates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:706" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora (Ponti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os Ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes (solis imago),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:685" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem (with perferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbiam (miseratio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>: luridaque evictos effugit umbra rogos, <hi rend="ital">vanquished</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from which it has struggled free</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus caelebs Evincet ulmos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>will supplant them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">evincit herbas lupinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 21, 50, § 185</bibl></cit>.—Less freq., </sense><sense id="n16488.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry one's point</hi>, <cb n="EVOC" /> <hi rend="ital">to prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi> in a thing. </sense><sense id="n16488.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">evincunt instando, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 9, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:248" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 248</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n16488.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to recover one's property by judicial decision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive tota res evincatur sive pars, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1" default="NO">1</bibl> sq.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 45</bibl>, and v. evictio.—* </sense><sense id="n16488.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for convinco (2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to succeed in proving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to demonstrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evince</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si puerilius his ratio esse evincet amare,</quote> <trans><tr>will evince</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 250</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evinctus: <entryFree id="n16489" type="main" key="e_vinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from evincio.</entryFree>
eviolo: <entryFree id="n16490" type="main" key="e_vi^o^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvĭŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 16</bibl> (dub.; v. evolvo, B. 2.).</sense></entryFree>
eviratio: <entryFree id="n16491" type="hapax" key="e_vi^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvĭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eviro</etym>, <sense id="n16491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a depriving of manhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a removing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eviratus: <entryFree id="n16492" type="main" key="e_vi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from eviro.</entryFree>
eviresco: <entryFree id="n16493" type="hapax" key="e_vi^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĭresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n16493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become pale</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eviro: <entryFree id="n16494" type="main" key="e_vi^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vĭro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n16494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of virility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to emasculate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unman</hi>, (rare): omnes pueros, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 187</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16494.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive of strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore evirato animae substantia turbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:178" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emissus (sanguis) rationabiliter relevat, enormiter ablatus evirat vel turbat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">unmanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eviratior spadone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 41, 1</bibl></cit> (with mollior).</sense></entryFree>
eviscero: <entryFree id="n16495" type="main" key="e_visce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-viscĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n16495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose). </sense><sense id="n16495.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To deprive of the entrails</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disembowel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16495.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl> (Trag. v. 413 ed. Vahl.); Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— Hence, </sense><sense id="n16495.3" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to tear to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lacerate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbam (accipiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 723</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16495.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dissipate</tr>, <tr>squander</tr>, <tr>exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 29, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Luc. 4, § 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceteri amnes abluant terras et eviscerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n16495.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take out of the bowels</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interior part.</hi>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unio e concha evisceratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
evitabilis: <entryFree id="n16496" type="main" key="e_vi_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvītābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. evito</etym>, <sense id="n16496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">avoidable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n16496.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 234</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16496.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala (opp. inevitabilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:50:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 50, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evitatio: <entryFree id="n16497" type="main" key="e_vi_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvītātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an avoiding</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evito: <entryFree id="n16498" type="main" key="e_vi_to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vīto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. since the Aug. per.): tela amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:116:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 116, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metaque fervidis Evitata rotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bidental,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:27" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">causas suspicionum offensionumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuatos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:194" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 57, 194</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">asperitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:71" default="NO">4, 1, 71</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n16499" type="main" key="e_vi_to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vīto</orth>, <itype>āre, āvi</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vita</etym>, <sense id="n16499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi> (ante- and post-class.): vidi, Priamo vi vitam evitari, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl> (Trag. v. 129 ed. Vahl.): evitat vitam regi, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 449, 32</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 181</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">tres juvenes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 133</bibl></cit> (al. enecasse); cf. <foreign lang="greek">*)enari/zw</foreign>, evito, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
evius: <entryFree id="n16500" type="main" key="E_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēvĭus</orth>, v. Euhius.</entryFree>
evocati: <entryFree id="n16501" type="main" key="e_vo^ca_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏcāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. evoco, B. 2. <sense id="n16501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
evocatio: <entryFree id="n16502" type="main" key="e_vo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evoco</etym>, <sense id="n16502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calling forth</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n16502.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">inferorum,</quote> <trans><tr>an evoking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum ex urbibus obsessis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n16502.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16502.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A summoning</hi> of a debtor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 56" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16502.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A calling out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summoning</hi> of soldiers on an occasion of sudden danger, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 614</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evocativus: <entryFree id="n16503" type="gloss" key="e_vo^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to summoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3460</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4968</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evocator: <entryFree id="n16504" type="hapax" key="e_vo^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who calls to arms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum et civium perditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evocatorius: <entryFree id="n16505" type="main" key="e_vo^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n16505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">citing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summoning</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">epistola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl></cit>. <cb n="EVOL" /></sense></entryFree>
evoco: <entryFree id="n16506" type="main" key="e_vo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n16506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call forth; to bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw forth</hi> (class. —syn. invito, cito, etc.). </sense><sense id="n16506.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16506.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tullia) evocavit virum e curia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatorem a navi huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem huc foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ante ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatores undique ad se,</quote> <trans><tr>to call together</tr>, <tr>summon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros ad pugnam,</quote> <trans><tr>to call out</tr>, <tr>challenge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16506.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sucum quasi per siphonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam ad extremas partes fricatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in longitudinem potius quam in latitudinem evocetur (salix),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:31:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis evocata ad fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16506.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n16506.5" n="1" level="3"> Relig. t. t.: deum, <hi rend="ital">to call a deity out of</hi> a besieged city, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 21, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1</bibl>. 8, 9.—</sense><sense id="n16506.6" n="2" level="3"> In civil and milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to call out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon to appear</hi>, sc. soldiers to military service: <cit><quote lang="la">(Metellus) evocat ad se Centuripinorum magistratus et decemprimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum omnem ad se Decetiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes cujusque civitatis ad se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 54, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes (senatores),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nominatim nobilissimum et fortissimum quemque ex omnibus civitatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 39, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas legiones ex hibernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites ex municipiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (legionem) initio tumultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem oppidanorum ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 58, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 44</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos undique spe praemiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 34, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n16506.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">probitas non praemiorum mercedibus evocata,</quote> <trans><tr>called forth</tr>, <tr>elicited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordia nullius oratione evocata,</quote> <trans><tr>called forth</tr>, <tr>produced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">indicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 12, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram, Sen. de Ira, 3, 8: risum lugentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem honorem evocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 57, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas (tacitas cogitationes) evocat in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17</bibl></cit>: aliquem in saevitiam ac violentiam, Sen. de Ira, 3, 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit> al.; cf. Gron. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏcā-tus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (cf. evoco, B. 2.): <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏcāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">soldiers who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having served out their time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were called upon to do military duty as volunteers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veterans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
evoe: <entryFree id="n16507" type="main" key="e_voe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvoe</orth>, v. euhoe.</entryFree>
evolatio: <entryFree id="n16508" type="main" key="e_vo^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evolo</etym>, <sense id="n16508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an escaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rising out of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evolito: <entryFree id="n16509" type="hapax" key="e_vo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n16509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly out frequently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
evolo: <entryFree id="n16510" type="main" key="e_vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n16510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly up</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16510.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quercu (aquila),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra septa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolandi potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:5:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 5, § 6</bibl></cit>: aut saepe ex humili sede sublima evolat, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 489, 5</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 211</bibl>): evolare ubi nec Pelopidarum facta neque famam audiam, <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12, 2</bibl>; and R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolaverunt nebulae sicut aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 43, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius (of geese),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:5:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 5, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16510.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to come forth quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex corporum vinculis, tamquam e carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostes) subito ex omnibus partibus silvae evolaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 27</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimatus evolat e senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus ex urbe, tamquam e vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per medias vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, lapidem ferro cum caedimus, evolat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 314</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16510.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(almost exclusively in Cic.): ii, quorum animi, spretis corporibus, evolant atque excurrunt foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones omnium perrumpat, evolet ex vestra severitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 38, 82</bibl>: ex poena, <pb n="669" /> <cb n="EVOM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem illi esse in principibus facile sunt passi, evolare altius certe noluerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to ascend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos dolent evolasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic evolavit oratio, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>rose</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos processus (Piso) efficiebat, ut evolare, non excurrere videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evolutio: <entryFree id="n16511" type="hapax" key="e_vo^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>evolvo, I. B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n16511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unrolling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opening</hi> of a book; hence, <hi rend="ital">a reading</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid poëtarum evolutio voluptatis affert?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
evolutus: <entryFree id="n16512" type="main" key="e_vo^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēvŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from evolvo.</entryFree>
evolvo: <entryFree id="n16513" type="main" key="e_volvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-volvo</orth>, <itype>volvi, vŏlūtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n16513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">per diaeresin</hi> ēvŏlŭam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ēvŏlŭisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 4</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to roll out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll forth; to unroll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfold</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n16513.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vis venti) Arbusta evolvens radicibus haurit ab imis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera turribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa nudis lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <trans><tr>to open</tr>, <tr>unfold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen epistolarum,</quote> <trans><tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panicum furfure,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cleanse</tr>, <tr>purge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae postquam evolvit,</quote> <trans><tr>unfolds</tr>, <tr>evolves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis prorutam in mare evolvendo terram praealtas voragines facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquas (Araxes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16513.2" n="b" level="4"> Evolvere se, or mid. evolvi, <hi rend="ital">to roll out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glide away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolvere posset in mare se Xanthus,</quote> <trans><tr>discharge itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 807</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Danubius in Pontum vastis sex fluminibus evolvitur,</quote> <trans><tr>empties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species (anguis) evoluta repente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per humum evolvuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>roll themselves along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16513.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16513.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To unroll and read</hi> a book: <cit><quote lang="la">evolve diligenter ejus eum librum qui est de animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:657" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 657</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:307" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:238" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 238</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">transf.: poëtas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores penitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n16513.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw out</hi> a thread, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to spin</hi>, said of the Fates: <cit><quote lang="la">quae seriem fatorum pollice ducunt Longaque ferratis evolvunt saecula pensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt.
