Pros. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; and pregn., <hi rend="ital">to spin out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to spin to an end</hi>, said of the Fates: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc, quae dispensant mortalia fata, sorores Debuerant fusos evoluisse meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n16513.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc triduo Aut terra aut mari alicunde aliqua evolvam argentum tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16513.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n16513.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: si qui voluerit animi sui complicatam notionem evolvere, <hi rend="ital">to unroll</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to clear up</hi> (the figure being taken from a book), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 76</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa evolvit somni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turns over</tr>, <tr>revolves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:216" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 216</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">secum femineos dolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 116" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolutus integumentis dissimulationis (with nudatus),</quote> <trans><tr>unwrapped</tr>, <tr>stripped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolutus bonis,</quote> <trans><tr>robbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sede patria rebusque summis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praeda clandestina,</quote> <trans><tr>driven away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo possum remedio me evolvere ex his turbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se omni turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n16513.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to unfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam rerum omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: oras belli, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 178 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">totam deliberationem accuratius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem propositam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condita pectoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seriem fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 509</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:954" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 954</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n16513.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To roll away</hi>, of time, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elapse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolutis multis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 38, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum evolutus esset annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 24, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evoluto tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Esth. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
